test_line: assertEquals("Test [" + i + "]=" + value, TEST_DATA[i][2], doubleMetaphone.doubleMetaphone(value, true));
bug_description:
Bug Title: Comparison Failure in Codec project

Bug ID: 3

Project: Codec

Bug Type: SL SH SF

Details:

The bug in the Codec project was identified during the test case execution. The error message from the test execution described the issue as a comparison failure. More specifically, the expected output from the test was not matching with the actual result. The test case expected output for the value 'AN[J]R' whereas the actual outcome was 'AN[K]R'. The source of the error was spotted in the method "handleG" of the respective Java class.

Findings based on an examination of the faulty code:

The problematic line of code appears to be related to a conditional statement that checks if the given input contains the substring "IER". When the substring "IER" is found at the specific index and length, the code appends the character 'J' to the result. The bug arises from a probable off-by-one error in this condition: the faulty line checks for the substring "IER" at the length of 4 characters, when it should be checking the length of only 3 characters.

Fixed Code:

The bug was rectified by correcting the length parameter in the "contains" method from 4 to 3. Now, when the input character sequence contains the substring "IER", the function correctly appends 'J' to the result. 

Final Step:

After applying the necessary fix, re-run the test case to ensure the bug was solved effectively. If the test case passes, it will confirm that the output matches with the expected results, reflecting the completeness of the bug resolving process. Continue with regression testing to ensure your fix did not unintentionally create new bugs elsewhere in the code.
